intro: Pilosella dublanensis, commonly known as the Dublan hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the eastern Mediterranean. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Pilosella dublanensis is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
